website_summaries.verdict: A highly reviewed entry-level 3D printer that arrives almost completely assembled.
pros: it's not a lengthy process as it is with some other 3D printers
Includes screen for added visual help and cues
Print pauses if filament runs out and resumes after it's refilled
cons: Some people have trouble leveling the bed
Customer support is decent but the process of getting help may take a while

customer_reviews.title: HAD TO RETURN 2 PRINTERS THAT DIED IN UNDER A MONTH. NOT A FUN TIME.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought the motherboard went haywire after about 3 weeks. Returned it and gave Anycubic the benefit of the doubt that it was just a lemon Ordered a second one, right out the box the X axis motors would not move completely they would stop half way. Adjusting the belt tension, checking the wires for two hours resulted in me packing it up and returning it AGAIN.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Dies quickly
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for about a month. Now two months into using it, it has completely died. Tried replacing switch, power supply with no luck. Waiting to receive motherboard replacement if they ever send one.. Completely useless and a big waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just got it today and it continuously reboots in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today and it continuously reboots in the middle of a project. Tried troubleshooting to no avail. Returning asap.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Can't print more than 2 hours...
customer_reviews.text: Around the 2 hour mark it stops extruding filament. The feed wheel just chews up and breaks the filament. After this I have to clear the filament tube and try again. I've tried 2 different 3 hour prints over the course of 2 days 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: shane erickson

customer_reviews.title: Costly paperweight.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in this product right now. I can't even print with it. I have wasted so much filament its not even funny. Whenever I start to print, it works for the first few initial passes then immediately the bed and extruder rapidly cool and the stop feeding/printing. I have watched dozens of videos and read the manual on how to operate this machine while I was waiting for it.The prints don't always start in the middle and I can't get it so center in the "Home" position. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: WakenBacon

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: The box I received had 3 shipping labels to other customers, It was obviously opened and assembled multiple times. The face plate was dented and the touch screen was scratched. The ports for the wires on the z-axis motor were completely pulled out and wires were hanging loose and unconnected. The black PLA it comes with was pulled out and blue was jammed in and had wisps in the box I DID NOT receive a new machine. Everything I have read says this is a good starter unit but If amazon is going to just ship you the broken one I'm returning (and 3 others as well ) Id go somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Pip's Dice & Games

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 days of moderate use.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 3 days with moderate use. Then the nozzle stopped heating, so it wouldn't extrude material. Nice machine other than it breaking so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bordin

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than a day
customer_reviews.text: Looked promising, soon disappointed as stepper motor controlling filament immediately started moving back and for spiratically. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: LIZA GARZA

customer_reviews.title: Print Bed Warped
customer_reviews.text: QA is terrible, print bed so warped it was impossible to level
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Work good for a couple prints now its JUNK!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a few prints both USB and from the SD card, then it stop working the printer would heat up to temp and just sit there and not print. I did email anycubic customer service they told me it could be a nozzle temp fluctuations. So i asked how to fix it but they keep telling me to print this DOG test i have tried from both USB and SD card with no luck, but they dont understand it wont print it gets up to temp and still wont print. So think i wll just throw the printer in the trash and get a ULTIMAKER. I would of gave it ZERO stars but it wouldnt let me.
customer_reviews.author: P. Riley

customer_reviews.title: Seems like every couple weeks something goes wrong with this item
customer_reviews.text: Seems like every couple weeks something goes wrong with this item. I would definitely look into something better rather than purchasing one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is only good for printing solid objects where there is no nozzle ...
customer_reviews.text: It is only good for printing solid objects where there is no nozzle travel required - no matter how much you turn down the filament temp, speed up the retraction, adjust retraction height, filament retraction amount, travel speed, it will ooze and leave strings. Never had this problem with the Flashforge Creator that I've had for 3+ years. It is really a shame that this otherwise quality-looking printer with many parts and freebees fails at this very important detail.
customer_reviews.author: DarkHorseDP

customer_reviews.title: Great Plug and Play Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had my share of 3d printers. Most kits are not for the amateurs. They are to complex as well as fragile. However this printer surpasses all those with ease of operation and performance. Eights screws and three cables to plug in and you ready. Just level the bed at each of the four corners and you are ready to print. The only drawback is the filament sensor. It should have been mounted to the frame. You have to be creative to resolve this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Support and Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for 3 1/2 months now and I am loving it. It took a while to get the bed leveled correctly due to a slight rise in the center, but now it just purrs. I have had a couple of blocked heads while printing wood PLA. One was solved with Mia's help, the other required a replaced head. Beyond those little issues, I have had no problems and have been printing nearly every day since I received it. I commend Anycubic3d for an excellent printer and excellent support.
customer_reviews.author: G. L. P.

customer_reviews.title: Good product for getting into 3D printing backed by a good company
customer_reviews.text: The i3 Mega produces solid prints in PLA and ABS. I'm planning on trying PETG soon, but see no reason why it won't work. The printer is easy to put together and made of quality parts. Tinkering and modifying it looks easy enough as well. I experienced a few issues with the printer when I first got it, but Anycubic was very helpful and we got those issues solved. For the money, it's one of the best valued printers out there. For any hobbyists, enthusiast, student, or even low-level production work, I would recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect.  Amazing price for the quality of print
customer_reviews.text: This machine works better than the 3D printer at work which my company paid over $20,000 for. The heated plate that grips when hot and releases when cool works like magic. Easy this is to use once you get the correct software. Download and use CURA 2.7.0 or later Do not use the version of CURA that comes with the unit as it requires you to type in several printing parameters, and makes the printing process to exceedingly slow. With CURA 2.7.0 all you need to do is tell the machine to use ‘recommended’ settings, what material you are using, if you want to have support or not.
customer_reviews.author: greenwood

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer
customer_reviews.text: I now have 3 of these little printers. I know that people question stuff from China but I've had good luck so far. When I got them I checked every portion of the machine and tightened a lot of cables and bolts. Thier QC isn't the best. But once together they run great. I print a product and I have had these things running for over a month 24 hours a day with little issues. Nothing I don't get from my other printers.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 days.
customer_reviews.text: It was good for the 2 days it worked. Now the screen flickers, the heat bed stays cold and the hot end never gets up to temperature. Will see if support will help and I will change the ratings.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Parade

customer_reviews.title: Good printer without a lot of assembly.
customer_reviews.text: I got this 3d printer because I did not want one of the "kits" that required building it from a box of parts. It assembled quickly and everything worked when I turned it on. At first I thought I had a warped heated bed as some have reported but I found that I just needed to align the unit better. 3d printers have to be set up and properly aligned to get good prints and I found out that when I took the time to do that it makes all the difference in the world. I also got help from their service department when I had some questions.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for a 3d Printing hobbist!
customer_reviews.text: I am totally happy with this printer! I have printed many things since purchase and have not had any problems. The bed needs to be leveled and it will print pretty much anything you throw at it. I have it hooked up to a Raspberry Pi running OctoPrint with a Playstation Eye camera. Super awesome printer and I love the Ultrabase. prints will stick like crazy until cooled and then they just come off. I had one problem where the extruder scratched the bed. Contacted support and they told me how to adjust the Z axis screws and sent me a new Ultrabase free of charge. A+++!
customer_reviews.author: Leatherneck

customer_reviews.title: Works great with minimal setup.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3D Printer and I had my first print going within 45 minutes after opening the box. The longest part of getting it setup was leveling the bed which I recommend you take your time with to get it right. The only negative I have is that my bed is concave, slightly dished in the middle, which means I have to compensate for that during the levelling procedure. Also it can be on the loud side once all the fans kick in. Overall I am happy with my purchase and would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Long

customer_reviews.title: DOA product and no reply from support.
customer_reviews.text: Item was DOA. No way to contact support but an email address. No reply there. I will update this if I get a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Shickell

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 3D printer in the sub $300 price range. Easy to assemble and get printing, within 30 minutes of unboxing it was printing the owls included on the SD card. You can upgrade it considerably by printing parts such as bed-level knobs, filament spool holders, fan shrouds, brackets for the wires, bed handle, tool holders, lots of things. I wouldn't hesitate to buy some more of these to run a small print farm.
customer_reviews.author: The Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Was brilliant....except 1 small issue
customer_reviews.text: So I only had mine for a few weeks, but while it worked it was amazing. The ultra base was great for getting prints to just snap off. Prints where good even before I had it calibrated beyound just being level. Printed PLA like a champ. The issue....the green connection cable on mine was defective so it would come loose and cause all kinds of odd issues (I wasn't as comfortable with changing out the wiring coupler as I should have been). Amazon took mine back but didn't have any of the same in stock to replace it with so I had to go with something else as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Meijhana

customer_reviews.title: Get this printer if you want an easy, simple, wonderful printer.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to be my small/mid size workhorse printer for projects. I get amazing prints with minimal adjusting. I did upgrade it to the S after the first few months but even without the upgrades to the S it produces amazing prints. If you slice things right it can even make bigger stuff. Keep up the amazing work Anycubic! Next printer I want to get is the Photon to compare to my Peopoly Moai! :) I also would like to mention unlike the other reviewers as of recent I have had 0 troubles with Anycubic support. Their support agents are quick responding and have no problem sending parts if needed.
customer_reviews.author: James Koehler

customer_reviews.title: Heat beds have a problem with wires breaking.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these printers, I have two. However, be prepared to work on them yourself, because after sales support is terrible. Takes several days to get a response and you better be an engineer to do the evaluation to find out which part is bad. You would think there would be onboard diagnostics. Both of my printers had a wire break loose from the heat bed which cause them to stop working. You have to replace the whole heatbed instead of just having a plug on the circuit board. I found the only good way to get support was to go on Facebook and ask other users in the Anycubic group.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Milner

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic first 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 3D printer, I mainly chose it because of the feature/price ratio and from watching/reading lots of reviews about it. I have really been happy with the quality of the prints so far, and I know I can make them even better as I learn all the tricks and how to dial in the machine. I've contacted Anycubic's support through their website twice, both times the replied in under 24 hours and were very helpful. I have already recommended the i3 Mega to others thinking about getting their first 3D printer. I am giving it 5 stars because of the value for money and customer support I have gotten.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn D.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic first printer!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE 8/29: new motherboard did not fix issue. Anycubic sent a brand new machine to replace! Even with time delays between the US and China and the language barrier, really great customer service overall. Will update after this new printer has been running for a bit. UPDATE 8/1: Left Z axis motor stopped working after 6 days of none stop printing. Contacted Anycubic, and after testing they sent a new motherboard. Got my printer during Prime day and I couldn’t be happier! Fantastic prints compared to my friends higher end printers.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Stanfill

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic printer ! Prints PETG great !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Whoooo hooooo! Great ! Great ! Great! Made a bunch of stuff already! Best bed ever, PETG sticks so much you have to wait for the bed to cool to remove object! Set bed to 95c for petg, you will not be disappointed !
customer_reviews.author: J Pike

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I AM A PROFESSIONAL!!! Please never buy. It works well for a few months and the. It breaks down. The company pays for its reviews and I have proof. It also refused to give me my money back after I complained and went through their replacement process. I have reported them to the Better Business Bureau for fraud, false advertising and breaking warranty contract.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, but mine has a problem
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. Easy setup with good print results. A few weeks ago I would have given this thing 5 stars without hesitation, but it started having this problem where it stops in the middle of a print. Fans and heaters are all still running, the print head and bed just stop moving altogether. I've tried different files and different slicers and different SD cards but the problem still happens. I'm trying to set up Octoprint to figure it out since the manufacturer's website is difficult to navigate and support isnt easy to contact.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R

customer_reviews.title: it became clear to me that the AnyCubic I3 Mega is a great choice. I now have my unit assembled
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally new to 3d printing beyond the many hours I have spent watching videos about various models and their advantages. As I did my research regarding entry level printers, it became clear to me that the AnyCubic I3 Mega is a great choice. I now have my unit assembled, which took about 15 minutes, calibrated, another 20 minutes, and its printing as I write this. I couldn't be more satisfied. I highly recommend this unit. It prints magnificently, and the benefits of the ultra base are obvious. The Ultra base sets this printers apart from it's peers. Don't hesitate to buy one if you're in the market for an entry level printer that performs at a much higher level.
customer_reviews.author: george hampton

customer_reviews.title: 2 months in it stopped printing right
customer_reviews.text: First two months this thing was printing well enough, then suddenly a drastic falloff of quality, another month of troubleshooting and trying to fix the problems using hardware and software fixes and it just keeps having problems. mostly it's under extrusion. the first few layers are fine, but anything taller than 5-10 mm from the bed extrusion problems become quite apparent. i took the extruder gear out, cleaned it and the problem persists. I have already suggested people do not get this printer and i suggest you do so as well..... OH and the bed lining chipped about a month in.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Galligan

customer_reviews.title: This printer has changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible. 20 minutes to assemble and another 20 to level the bed and this thing has run continuously for many hours without a hitch. I use Cura slicer and FreeCad design software. FreeCad takes a commitment, but once you get it, it is very powerful. Heatbed makes a huge difference. After it cools, the prints just fall off. Everything in the house has a box or a bracket or holder of some kind. Thingiverse has a ton of designs you can use.
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: When it's working, it's great.  Constant issues though...
customer_reviews.text: This guy works great out of the box, but after a while I keep hitting problems. I imagine its an extrusion issue but I can't pinpoint it. I've swapped out the entire hot end assembly twice and re-ran bowden tubing to the extruder and keep hitting the exact same issues. If I'm lucky, I may get a print to work. Usually though, it'll hit about 20mm tall and just stop extruding suddenly. Not a fan, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Badge, the Younger

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit, Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Overall I've been happy with the quality of the prints pretty much right out of the box. Pros: -User interface is excellent -Print quality is good for the price range -Easy assembly -Ultrabase print bed is superb Cons: -Exceptionally noisy -Poor quality control Unfortunately the first one of these I ordered came with a defective hot end and the fan inside the chassis to cool the board was bent and vibrated against the metal. Fortunately Amazon has excellent return policies and the replacement item I received didn't have either of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Still learning, so far its great
customer_reviews.text: Got the Anycubic i3 mega on Sunday. Set it up and printed the Owls. They turned out great. Tried a file I downloaded and the item would not stay adhered to the base. Base showed 60c with not drops. May try some hairspray that others suggested on different forums and see if that helps with adhesion. Only problem I ran into is the scraper that came with the printer has burrs on the blade and scratched my base platform.
customer_reviews.author: JimmyS

customer_reviews.title: Low cost, not cheap.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awesome. It took a bit of setup, but the manual is very detailed if somewhat machine-translated. The bed leveling was a breeze. The only drawback is the slicer software. I'm used to a slicer that is a little more robust, but this gets the job done. The print quality is at least as good as the more expensive printers I've used. I recommend this printer without reservation. Next step, the Anycubic Photon DLP printer.
customer_reviews.author: Blane Robinson

customer_reviews.title: No power
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter's birthday. I put it together the day before and ... nothing. I checked and rechecked the connections and they were all good and secure. I tried to reset without the power connected and the next time I turned it on, the screen flashed and, that's all. Amazon was very helpful and provided a refund. Thank goodness. Now that I read these other reviews, I can't see myself ordering another one which is why I'm online today. Time to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Loch

customer_reviews.title: First 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking to get into 3D printing and don't know much about it, this is the printer for you. Out of the box there is only 8 screws and 2 parts to assemble. Loading filament, leveling the print bed, and getting ready to print is a piece of cake. From box to printing took less than one hour. The owl test print turned out amazing. I'm very excited to continue printing. (Will update as I continue use)
customer_reviews.author: Ross Miller

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to level
customer_reviews.text: Spent a few hours 3 days trying to level this bed and get it to print a decent product. I have 2 other 3D printers with 0 issues but for the life of me this thing did nothing but waste my time and PLA. Would leave 0 stars if possible. Ended up returning.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. Wolk

customer_reviews.title: Easy as Pie to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It literally took me 15 min to set this up and get it turned on.with that said the leveling part took me a bit to figure out.they don't tell you that you need paper tape sheets (Not Included) so that the filament will stick. the other printer i own has self leveling so it was a learning curve for me. with that said i am very pleased with it once it was all set up.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Menshek

customer_reviews.title: Plz read honest review
customer_reviews.text: Love it hate it! Prints amazing parts. And plate works 70% of the time u have to have a skirt on every print. The tip went bad after 2 spool changes of different colors it seems to have feeding issues bad. And it won’t stop beeping at u all the time when it turns on. It won’t shut up. It hates print off the card it stop for what ever. Then has a continue bottom but tries to go home and crushes everything and gets missalined so easily.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: worked good then started falling apart
customer_reviews.text: I used this printer for end use parts for my business. and after 2 weeks the plastic clamps that hold the hot end to the x axis broke of for no reason. replaced with prusa style bearings , x axis rods are uneven, bolts striped from the factory and its more trouble then its worth to try to fix it. The y axis started making loud clunks and bangs randomly. Ultrabase began ot let prints go randomly, bed cleaned with 99% isopropol alcohol. The bed itself is a pain in the arse to level.
customer_reviews.author: joe mcandrew

customer_reviews.title: The price point and the ease of assembly for this printer is amazing. The prints come out clean and after I ...
customer_reviews.text: Well after a few weeks of use and tweaking I can finally make a review. The price point and the ease of assembly for this printer is amazing. The prints come out clean and after I got my settings dialed in its been printing almost flawlessly. Few issues were the filament sensor kept popping off the magnet and would cause the filament to break when being fed and retracted repeatedly. This is not a put together and start printing right away. You will need to fiddle with the settings and make sure you level the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Great printer has worked well for us
customer_reviews.text: We have been running this printer practically nonstop for about 4 months now and it has performed wonderfully. At one point we ran into a problem where the head wouldn't heat up so contacted support. Their support team responded quickly with images and diagrams to help me to check what might be wrong. With that I had it fixed in a few moments. However, it required a voltmeter and a little bit of experience to troubleshoot it- which not many people might not have. Overall though, I like the plate size, support, and the general durability of the printer.
customer_reviews.author: John Orgill

customer_reviews.title: moving bed
customer_reviews.text: I love my printer. I got it as a Christmas present and have not stopped using it since literally running all day. My main complaint is that the bed moves and I need to use rafts to get anything to stay. I'm still very new to printing so maybe it is my inexperience that makes the raft necessary. My other complaint is they don't offer an option to upgrade to the lager bed and it must be bought separately.
customer_reviews.author: Carole A Mansur

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 1st 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: Before I got the Anycubic Mega i3 I didn't really know much about 3d printers. This was super easy to assemble and get right to my 1st print. I did have a little problem with my printer and the Anycubic customer service was very prompt and solved my issue right away with no hassle. I highly recommend this printer for 1st timers or experienced makers looking for a very reasonably priced 3d printer. Oh, the heated Ultrabase makes removing the finished print a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: goslin23

customer_reviews.title: Proto's and learning
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one based on reviews and the costs for the purpose of learning. I was amazed at the quality of the prints and how easy it was to set up. Many say if "I can do it, so can you". In my case this is true, I'm no genius so if you need a good learning tool for your first buy, I recommend this. The price and quality of future machines can only get better.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Dee

customer_reviews.title: Short circuited and started smoking
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this machine but after only having it for a few months (August 22nd to December 20th) the entire thing broke. He had fixed and replaced different parts over the past few months that we’ve had it, and I thought that may be natural, and they were pretty inexpensive parts. This time the whole display went blank and the machine started smoking. It literally caught fire. I’m looking for a new brand now. He loved his hobby so much and I can tell how bummed he is that it’s broken. I can’t believe I wasted so much money on this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Parcellin

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic printer for the price. I will admit that the power unit died within 2 hours of use, but their customer service was good and they sent me a new one. It even prints well with the PLA that comes with it. The dragon pictured was an 18h print at 0.06 layer height and 40mm/s. Prints well in ABS too. Both PLA and ABS stick perfectly, they are hard to remove until the bed cools a little and then they just pick up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my son as a Christmas gift. Got it all put together and followed instruction. When trying to level the print bed one of the motors would not stop trying to move. switch to tell it to stop on that motor is not wired properly or something becasue there is no audible beep like other side . Switched out sensors and still doesnt work. Emailed customer support and told I have to go through Anycubic who yes got back to me but keep askling for videos and pics and after three responses are no further along than the first email. Shouldnt be this much work for something that should have worked out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Erik B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent 3d printer. Looked at a ton of them and ended up going with the Anycubic. Extremely easy set up. Watched a couple videos on YouTube and was printing in no time. Prints are very high quality. Glad I picked this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great First 3D Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for my son and I based on a really good video review on Youtube. The person mentioned that it took little set up and it was solid construction. I completely agree. It took me very little time to set this thing up, level the bed and print my first test. I totally recommend this to anyone that is looking for an affordable yet reliable 3d printer. I have already been able to find plenty of free plans online to print cool things with my son.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Too much tinkering involved
customer_reviews.text: After months of owning this printer, I would not recommend it. I have had problems after problems with it. It seems as though every time I solve a problem, a new one arise. If I wanted to work on a 3d printer this much, I would have just built one myself.
customer_reviews.author: amazo

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer under 500
customer_reviews.text: What a great printer for the price. This is easily the best printer you can find for under 500. The print quality is very good. Yes it took me some time to level the bed, and I had to replace the hot end with the spare they send, but it helped me learn more about the printer and 3d printing in general. Buy this printer!
customer_reviews.author: Duffman

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband for Christmas. Arrived quickly, husband was able to set it up easily; not sure if that’s because he has experience with other electronics or if it’s just that simple, but he has no issues. He has printed several projects so far with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: cDub

customer_reviews.title: Great starting printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great right out of the box and after leveling. Assembly was easy and they give you all the tools you will need for assembly and normal operation. After about 35 prints I noticed the sd card reader and power supply failed. The customer service is top notch. They sent me out replacement parts right away and provided documentation on installation. The electronics are hidden away unlike some cheap printers and that makes this one much safer to be out in the open. Overall greater printer for the price. With printers the settings are are the most important factor.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought this printer and it has been fantastic. Setup was extremely easy, and print quality is excellent. I originally had an issue (which turned out to be just a misunderstanding of the way this printer works on my part) and contacted Anycubic’s support. Zoe was excellent and emailed me back and forth until the issue was resolved. The only negative i can find is that the included roll of filament is ok, but you can get better prints with higher quality filament. I attached some prints of 3dBenchy I made with stock settings and Pink PLA filament to show the quality.
customer_reviews.author: James Poe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, high quality 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: I've been printing with this printer for about 3 weeks. It's my first 3D printer, so not a lot to compare it to. But I did a lot of research prior to buying it. So far it's been outstanding. It was easy to assemble and the printing has been great. I was originally going to get the Prusa i3 MK3, but I couldn't get it shipped to my location. That worked out for me -- this one has been printing great, for less than half the price. It came with good tools, some spare parts, and a full spool of PLA. Con: bit noisy, but I close the door to that room and no issue.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: Buy it if you are on the fence about a 3D printer!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing!! Great printer! I had no idea what I was doing at first. Super easy to use. I have been printing non stop since I set it up. Great if you are a first time user or looking to up date.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice printer,easy assembly about 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I now have 2 3D printers, this my goto most of the time. It works great and has a fair price I am very pleased with my with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tag1945

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: The overall build and print quality is excellent. The only reason I deducted a star is that, after a couple of months, the ULTRABASE print bed stopped sticking. Tried wiping down with alcohol and still no adhesion. Had to go back to using hair spray like with the old glass beds.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine after a month
customer_reviews.text: Have been running mostly PLA prints for NERF related parts and as long as its not jostled too much it hasn't been to be re-leveled unless it was moved. Good quality printer for its price, and seems easy to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Abrlcklnthewall

customer_reviews.title: Great starter printer
customer_reviews.text: My first time using a 3d printer i was able to print right out of the box. I was also able to create custom prints on the third day. the only reason I gave it 4 stars is due to lack of experience in 3d printing. Meaning this is the only printer I've ever used. And spool issues. parts are fairly priced
customer_reviews.author: TEMP NEWT 62

customer_reviews.title: Great, Versatile printer for great cost
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. I've had it for about a year and have put at least 1000 hours on it. I have had the typical tangle ups with filament, and I've replaced the hot end once. Although, a spare was included, so it was a trivial replacement. I like this so much I purchased another one for my dad (68 years old). He is not computer savvy and has no trouble creating or downloading designs and printing. Definitely one of my favorite purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent First 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: After much review and comparison I chose to purchase this printer. I had never seen or used a 3d printer before and was apprehensive as to whether I would be able to operate it and whether it would function well. This unit exceeded my expectations. It is well built, easy to use, and functions very well. I'm happy to say I have a new hobby! If you are in doubt to trust it, don't hesitate, it is a good value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer, 100% recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little printer, very easy to install and very easy to print. Love it!!!, Kids love to make their toys and play with it. Good build quality.
customer_reviews.author: DrGG

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer!
customer_reviews.text: I started with 1 I3 Mega getting my feet wet in 3d printing. Sure there were hiccups along the way, but once you get dialed in you're Golden. Ive experienced great customer service with Anycubic! When something goes wrong I let them know and within a day or so i have a solution via email. Sometimes the solution is replacing a part which has been very easy so far, and Anycubic is excellent on getting me replacement parts. Long story long...i now have 3 I3 mega's and a Chiron
customer_reviews.author: sandy boeseneilers

customer_reviews.title: Great product...great price
customer_reviews.text: Great item...leveling was kinda rough at first but have been very happy with my results. Able to print at .05mm height right out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Jesus B.

customer_reviews.title: Best 200mm i3 clone.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a major issue yet with it over months of use and more mechanical prints, have only printed with PLA. If you plan to make figures and stuff you may want a more accurate printer, but those can run $2,000+ .
customer_reviews.author: Streetguru

customer_reviews.title: fast and fun!
customer_reviews.text: this was a Christmas gift for my son so he just now opened it and is working with it. Sets up quickly and is super fast printing. He has already printed at least 5 things! easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Buffy M.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great printer. Was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer .Was easy to set up. The print quality was so great. People I have shown could believe how excellent the prints were.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R.

customer_reviews.title: Good Experience
customer_reviews.text: This is my second 3d printer and I love it. The packaging was well done and assembly straight forward. There was missing file on the SD card but, customer service got back within less than 1 business day and were extremely helpful. Once it was resolved I started printing and haven't had a problem since. If you don't mind minimal assembly this printer is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Henbest

customer_reviews.title: Perfect "industrial" 3d Printer
customer_reviews.text: Works immediately out of the box... minor "leveling" every few prints and you get perfect prints every time. Highly recommended... as this is my 2nd 3d printer both are AnyCubic i3 mega's.
customer_reviews.author: woodworking.dan

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer, Very reliable
customer_reviews.text: It's been 2 month since I got it. Everything is good. Quality, reliability, etc. The only thing I had to mention is that it's adapatbility with software. I have to choose prusa instead of i3 mega in Cura if I need it to work properly, or the nozzle will hit building plate. I will it will have it's own slicer like photon did.
customer_reviews.author: Yimin Wu

customer_reviews.title: Biggest Paperweight
customer_reviews.text: First my order was delayed for over a month. Then it came in, and I wrestled with odd instructions. Not all too bad that, as it did help to understand the machine. However, after completing it, checking it, and rechecking it, I got the “T0 sensor abnormal” problem. The only solution in the guide is to check the wiring. Didn’t help. Googling doesn’t help. TL;DR it’s a lottery and the winner gets the broken one.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Blasco

customer_reviews.title: OK starter printer. Requires some troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.text: SD card included with printer did not work properly. Support was not helpful in getting me a new one, but I was able to use my own. Extruder also has trouble heating on its own. Printer has to be preheated before starting a print, otherwise it does not heat up. Not an ideal printer, but is a good starter for the price if you don't mind some troubleshooting.
customer_reviews.author: An Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: 2 in a row failed, gave up.
customer_reviews.text: The first one printed great right out of the box, then just all the sudden would die as soon as the hot end started heating up. Got another one shipped out as a replacement, that one never even worked out of the box. I think it was probably the part that pushes the filiment through as it was jamming up the hot end. Tried the spare hot end it comes with, same thing. Sent them both back for a refund. A+ for Amazon's return process though. Was very easy and quickly refunded me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Peterson

customer_reviews.title: This little printer is great for entry-level users
customer_reviews.text: This little printer is great for entry-level users. Minimal assembly, easy setup, and integrates with OctoPrint without issue. I had a problem with one of the fans in the hotend making noise, but after writing to support they mailed me a whole new set of them! They responded very quickly and after replacing the fan (requires disassembly of the hotend, not too hard) everything is peachy.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Tierney

customer_reviews.title: Anycubic i3 Mega 3d printer.
customer_reviews.text: The printer does a great job of printing for its price. Have only had for about a week, but am very happy with it. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good low priced 3d printer. Update: Just finished printing this 3d scanner frame. Anycubic i3 Mega worked flawlessly with excellent result. Extremely happy with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Marker

customer_reviews.title: this is my first 3d printer and i love it great for beginners who are just getting into ...
customer_reviews.text: this is my first 3d printer and i love it great for beginners who are just getting into 3d printing and comes with lots of goodies and a 1.0Kg rooll of black PLA to get started
customer_reviews.author: jorge a cortes jr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is very well made and creates amazing 3-D items. My son ordered it and has printed a lot with it. The software is easy to use with it. It takes a while to print something but is has perfect detail. He is still learning but so far, so good
customer_reviews.author: Alan & Tish Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and align bed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and align bed. Test print worked fantastic, no problem. The improved print bed works great and prints release when the bed has cooled back off to room temperature. Very nice for a starting 3d printer that is not very expensive. Was packaged safely.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C.

customer_reviews.title: A good beginner printer for a well seasoned maker
customer_reviews.text: What little I’ve found wrong with this printer is easily remedied with basic mechanical know-how. The extruder gear set screw tends to loosen after 20+ hours and the included memory card should be ditched immediately for a higher grade to avoid corruption in the gcode files. Outside of that, minimal Preventative maintenance and you’ll have worry free good quality prints.
customer_reviews.author: 3AMworks

customer_reviews.title: Probably not for a novice
customer_reviews.text: I have never managed to get the table leveled. I'm sure that's my fault not the machines
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Lots of upgrades possible. NOT plug-n-Play though
customer_reviews.text: Biggest problem is missing set screws on table drive wheel. Fortunately there is much to learn from YouTube. Hotend goes to 260 C. which is good enough for PETG.
customer_reviews.author: Madfranklin

customer_reviews.title: Reliable printer
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up- using cura software so once settings were dialed in this printer has been chugging along. For the price this printer is a great value
customer_reviews.author: Yeszenknow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Never used a 3d printer before. I calibrated it and was up and running practically instantly. After an hour of adjustments my prints are close to perfect. Super easy, great quality prints and just awesome. Fan is kinda loud, but I don't mind it at all. I've had this thing printing non-stop for about a week in my living room. Coolest thing I've ever bought. Just awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Whit

customer_reviews.title: The product is excelent but this arrived beaten.
customer_reviews.text: Good day, The printer arrived beaten, as shown in the photo I send, I had not written them because I wanted to see if the operation of the equipment was affected. I tried it and it took me a lot to calibrate it, I do not know if it was a blow or something normal the first time. In the first impression, which marks the manual (Owl_pair.gcode), the nozzle was covered and I had to replace it with the new one, now apparently it already prints well. I hope I do not have any later problems.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Uc Rios

customer_reviews.title: Reliably 3d printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second FDM printer. Does a good job printing, nice heated bed. I had an issue with my heated bed coming unglued, and tech support quickly helped me out and sent me a new one. I've gone through several roles of filament and it keeps on going. The slicing software is Cura, by MakerBot, which is good and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. McCrossin

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three of these printers for my classroom to setup a 3d printing elective for middle school science. The students assembled the printers and we were able to start printing after about an hour. I am impressed with the build quality and ease of use. I would recommend this printer for someone just starting out or someone looking for easy reliable printing.
customer_reviews.author: Paulina

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this machine! I'm a noob when it comes to 3D printing but I did my research and have less of a hard time because of that. I would recommend this. Just make sure all you cables are in.
customer_reviews.author: A Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Very good printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have had the printer 4 days, Very good printer for the price. Very easy to setup and perform the first print. I have contacted support several times with just some general questions,. They respond back very quickly, being located in China. I will report back with my experiences over time.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Pitz

customer_reviews.title: My first 3d print great results so far 5 day so far and its ...
customer_reviews.text: My first 3d print great results so far 5 day so far and its been running 24/7. Took my time setting it up and leveling the bed, so far no bad prints.
customer_reviews.author: gwbuss

customer_reviews.title: Awesome just totally awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to say for me which is better the cr-10 mini or the Anycubic i3 mega .with the Anycubic i3 mega I was printing 20 mins out of box
customer_reviews.author: gcrizwell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great 3d Printer. Works as expected right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Rafy

customer_reviews.title: Already recommended to a friend, and he liked it too
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality of this machine, as well as the output. Already thinking about buying another one - just trying to find the space. :)
customer_reviews.author: J. Siefer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around 3D printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 3D printer. The heated bed doesn't require glue or hairspray. It has a sensor for when it runs out of PLA. Comes with an extra print head, 1kg of PLA, prints and prints and prints without issues. Touchpanel is easy to use. - An engineer that loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: works like a charm, every time, all the time. would recommend to anyone starting out in 3d printing, or anyone looking for a reliable i3 printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Anycubic Full Metal i3 Mega 3D Printer with Ultrabase Heatbed and 3.5 Inch Touch Screen
feature_bullets: Plug and play with user friendly screen: complete the assembling with 8 screws, then start to play through a 3.5-Inch tft touch screen
Anycubic ultra base: Anycubic patented heat bed, super adhesion, smoothly lattice bottom surface. Easier to take off 3D-171 by hands, so you won't need masking tape and glue stickers any more
Filament detection: automatic printing pause when filament runs out, resume after filament re-load with just one click
Anycubic Advantage: We take care of all parts of unartificial quality-related issues with a replacement for 3 months after the purchase date, and provide lifetime technical support

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
